Name: 3DXRD
Description: 3DXRD is a far field diffraction technique capable of reconstructing polycrystalline materials from the individual diffraction spots recorded in the diffraction pattern given that the crystallographic parameters of the material are known. The success of the technique is based on the ability of the individual diffraction spots to be separated. This means there is a trade off between the number of grains and the degree of strain that is measurable.

Name: CDI
Alternative names: Coherent Diffraction Imaging, CXD, CXDI, Coherent X-Ray Diffraction, Coherent X-ray Diffraction Imaging

Name: CRYO-EM
Description: TEM applied to samples cooled to cryogenic temperatures.

Name: DCT
Description: DCT is a near-field diffraction-based imaging technique that provides high-resolution grain maps of polycrystalline materials (Ludwig et al. 2008). For each individual grain, the technique can provide orientation and average elastic strain tensor components with an accuracy of a few times 1e-4 (Reischig et al. 2013). The technique combines the concepts of image reconstruction from projections (tomography) and X-ray diffraction imaging (topography).

Name: ED-EXAFS
Alternative names: Energy Dispersive Extended X-ray Absorption Fine Structure
Description: EXAFS can be called ED-EXAFS when you measure the X-ray absorption probability as a function of energy all at once by dispersing the X-ray energies in space

Name: ED-XANES
Alternative names: Energy Dispersive X-ray Absorption Near Edge Structure
Description: XANES can be called ED-XANES when you measure the X-ray absorption probability as a function of energy all at once by dispersing the X-ray energies in space

Name: ED-XAS
Description: XAS can be called ED-XAS when you measure the X-ray absorption probability as a function of energy all at once by dispersing the X-ray energies in space

Name: ED-XRD
Alternative names: Energy Dispersive X-ray Diffraction, XRD with an energy dispersive detector.

Name: ED-XRF
Description: XRF with an energy dispersive detector.

Name: ED-XRPD
Description: XRPD with an energy dispersive detector.

Name: EDS
Description: EDS measures X-ray photons coming from a sample during electron irradition  with an energy dispersive detector and derives elemental composition from the energy of the fluorescence photons

Name: EM
Description: An electron microscope is a microscope that uses a beam of electrons as a source of illumination. They use electron optics that are analogous to the glass lenses of an optical light microscope to control the electron beam, for instance focusing it to produce magnified images or electron diffraction patterns.

Name: EXAFS
Description: XAS can be called EXAFS when looking at the absorption probability within an X-ray photon energy range greater than 500 eV.

Name: FF-XRF
Description: XRF which provides elemental distributions in a 2D projection of the sample in space. The spatial separation is achieved on the detection side.

Name: GISAXS
Alternative names: Grazing Incidence Small Angle X-ray Scattering

Name: HERFD-XAS
Alternative names: High-Energy Resolution Fluorescence Detected X-ray Absorption Spectroscopy, HERFD, High-Energy Resolution Fluorescence Detected

Name: HR-XRPD
Description: Like XRPD but with a high resolution in Q-space (or d-spacing).

Name: LDDC-XAS
Alternative names: Laser-Driven Dynamic Compression X-ray Absorption Spectroscopy, Laser-Driven Shock Compression X-ray Absorption Spectroscopy

Name: MACRO-XRF
Description: XRF which provides elemental distributions in a 2D projection of the sample in space. The spatial separation is achieved by moving the sample thourhg a beam is beam size greater that 100 micron.

Name: MICRO-XRF
Description: XRF which provides elemental distributions in a 2D projection of the sample in space. The spatial separation is achieved by moving the sample thourhg a beam is beam size between 0.1 and 100 micron.

Name: NANO-XRF
Description: XRF which provides elemental distributions in a 2D projection of the sample in space. The spatial separation is achieved by moving the sample thourhg a beam is beam size between 0.1 and 100 nanometers.

Name: NFS
Description: Time-domain analog of Mössbauer spectroscopy

Name: NRIXS
Description: Measures phonon density of states

Name: PFY-XAS
Alternative names: Partial Fluorescence Yield X-ray Absorption Spectroscopy

Name: SCXRD
Alternative names: Single crystal X-ray diffraction, SC-XRD, SCD, SXRD
Description: Single crystal X-ray diffraction measured the diffraction from a single crystal to determine its crystal structure.

Name: SSX
Description: Like SCXRD but instead of measuring the same crystal under different orientations we measure many individual crystals with random orientation.

Name: TEM
Description: EM in which a beam of electrons is transmitted through a specimen to form an image.

Name: TFY-XAS
Alternative names: Total Fluorescence Yield X-ray Absorption Spectroscopy

Name: TR-USAXS
Alternative names: Time Resolved Ultra-Small Angle X-ray Scattering

Name: USA-XPCS
Alternative names: Ultra-Small Angle X-Ray Photon Correlation Spectroscopy

Name: WDS
Description: WDS measures X-ray photons coming from a sample during irradition with a wavelength dispersive detector and derives elemental composition from the energy of the fluorescence photons

Name: XANES
Description: XAS can be called XANES when looking  at the absorption probability within an X-ray photon energy range smaller than 500 eV.

Name: XAS
Description: XAS measures a signal related to the X-ray absorption probability (could be fluorescence, photon electrons, auger electrons, all electrons, transmission) as function of the incomming X-ray photon energy. X-rays are absorbed by atomic core excitation (remove and core-shell electron from an atom).

Name: XES
Description: XRF with a high energy resolution.

Name: XFCT
Description: XRF which provides elemental distributions in the sample 3D by measuring fluorescence in 2D or 1D projection under many orientations.

Name: XPCI
Alternative names: X-ray Phase-Contrast Imaging, PCXI, Phase-Contrast X-ray Imaging

Name: XRAYS
Description: Experimental technique with X-ray irradiation of the sample under investigation.

Name: XRD
Description: X-ray diffraction measured the diffraction from a crystalline sample to determine the crystal structure, molecular structure, multi-phase identification and composition, ...

Name: XRF
Description: XRF measures X-ray photons coming from a sample during irradition with X-rays and derives elemental composition from the energy of the fluorescence photons

Name: XRPD
Description: X-ray powder diffraction measured the diffraction from a powder to determine the crystal structure or multi-phase identifiaction and composition.

Name: XRR
Alternative names: X-ray Reflectometry, X-ray reflectivity, X-ray specular reflectivity
Description: A surface-sensitive analytical technique based on X-ray reflection used in chemistry, physics, and materials science to characterize surfaces, thin films and multilayers.

Name: XRT
Alternative names: X-Ray Topography, X-Ray Diffraction Topography, XDT
